title: Embention and EANAN Form Strategic Alliance for Dubai's Unmanned Aircraft Growth
originSummary: Embention and EANAN have formed a strategic alliance to manufacture unmanned aircraft in Dubai, with an initial investment of $5 million.
The joint venture aims to produce a minimum of 3,000 Veronte Autopilots annually, contributing to sustainable air mobility in the UAE.
The agreement was signed during the Dubai Airshow 2023 and marks the official launch of the first fleet of locally designed and produced drones in Dubai.

title: GA-ASI Demonstrates UAS STOL Capability on UK Carrier
originSummary: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc (GA-ASI) successfully demonstrated the short takeoff and landing (STOL) capability of its Mojave Unmanned Aircraft System on the HMS Prince of Wales, a Royal Navy aircraft carrier.
This demonstration proves that the UAS can effectively operate from warships, expanding the potential for multi-domain naval operations.

GA-ASI plans to offer a STOL wing set option for its MQ-9B aircraft, which could be utilized by the Royal Navy and other navies on large flat-deck warships, enhancing the versatility of UAS operations in previously unsuitable areas.

title: Top 5 Tactical Gear Revealed at Modern Warfare Week
originSummary: Modern Warfare Week showcased the latest military weapons and gear at a shooting range in Sampson County.
Items displayed included suppressors for rifles, virtual missile training systems, a modular munition system, thermal optics, and a small aerial munition launcher.

The suppressors are being fielded by the Marines to reduce the sound and flash of firearms. The virtual missile training system provides realistic training for air defense artillery units while eliminating costs. The modular munition system has both humanitarian and warfighting applications and can be attached to any drone system. The thermal optics enable soldiers to detect targets in all weather conditions without lasers. The small aerial munition launcher, when attached to a drone, allows for precision fires.

title: UK armed forces equipment: submarines, naval vessels, army battalions, and air power
originSummary: The UK armed forces' latest annual report reveals that there are 10 submarines and 72 vessels in the naval fleet, with a slight decrease in Royal Navy vessels.
The army has a mix of combat equipment and a total of 48 Army Battalions.
Critics argue that some listed equipment may not be fully operational, and there are concerns about the allocation of funds to foreign aid and the BBC instead of defense spending.

title: Global UAS Market to Reach USD 33,844.69 Million by 2027 - Analysis, Players, and Impact of COVID-19
originSummary: The global unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) market is expected to reach a value of USD 33,844.69 million by 2027, according to a report.
The report provides a comprehensive analysis of the market, including applications, types of UAS, leading players, and regional analysis.
The article briefly mentions the topics covered in a report on UAS revenue and market size, as well as the platform used for market research reports.

title: Arlington County Seeks Public Input on Drone Use for Public Safety
originSummary: Arlington County, Virginia is seeking public input on the potential use of drones for public safety purposes.
The proposed program would involve collaboration between different county departments and focus on specific public safety missions.
Draft policies outlining potential use cases for drones have been released, and residents are encouraged to provide feedback through the county's website.
If approved, Arlington County would join other jurisdictions that have implemented drone programs for public safety.
However, concerns about privacy have led some jurisdictions to postpone the implementation of drone programs.
